Articles.Content:
While waiting for the Jool Transfer, I've been sending Ion-driven probes to Eve and Moho. Immediately after leaving Kerbin SOI, I refined the approach and had encounters with both of them. When the alarm clock called me to the Moho SOI change, there was no such thing. I had to spend 800m/s to set up a new encounter. Then I checked with the Eve probe and found that it had lost its encounter as well.

This being Ion probes, I have lots of delta-V to spare. No harm done. But what happened? I did *NOT* fast-forward across any SOI change. To repeat, I set up the encounters while already outside of Kerbin SOI. Between then and now, the probes were on rails in the Suns' SOI.

How deep were your encounters? As in, how low was the periapsis?

Fast timewarp can cause small orbital calculation errors, which are worse if you're controlling a different ship. Since you already have KAC, I recommend setting up maneuver nodes part way through the transfer. That way, you can check on the transfer and make corrections early enough that they're cheap.

How deep were your encounters? As in, how low was the periapsis?

Quite deep, IMO: ~100km for Eve, none for Moho (you know, the really close encounter). Trajectories didn't wobble. Truth be told, the alarms were set to 10-20 days before SOI, for final adjustments. I was totally off course -- the new encounters I managed to set up are totally different from the old ones.
